definitions.definition: A compound most often formed by the condensation of an alcohol and an acid , with elimination of water , which contains the functional group carbon - oxygen double bond ( i.e. , carbonyl ) joined via carbon to another oxygen atom .

main_definition: ( organic chemistry ) A compound most often formed by the condensation of an alcohol and an acid , with elimination of water , which contains the functional group carbon - oxygen double bond ( i.e. , carbonyl ) joined via carbon to another oxygen atom .
